# Introduction 

# Basic Statistical Hypothesis Tests 
```{python}
import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd
from scipy import stats 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('rodent_2022-2023.csv') 
```

# Normality Tests 
## Shapiro-Wilk Test 
The Shapiro-Wilk test is performed with the null hypothesis assuming the data was drawn
from a normal distribution. 
```{python}
area = df.groupby('Incident Zip') 
area_counts = area.size() 
res = stats.shapiro(area_counts)
print(res)
```  

```{python}
plt.figure(figsize = (8, 4))
plt.hist(area_counts)
plt.show
```
